00001 from django.db import models

00003 
00004 
00005 ##This is used to create Account table in the database to store account information
00006 class Account(models.Model):
00007         ##Account number of type 'char'. This is the key of the table
00008     account_number = models.CharField(max_length=50)
00009         ##Account type of type 'char'
00010     account_type = models.CharField(max_length=50)
00011         ##Balance of type 'decimal'
00012     balance = models.DecimalField(max_digits=50, decimal_places=2)
00013         ##Name of the account holder, type: char
00014     name = models.CharField(max_length=50)
00015         ##Number of cheque books of type 'int'
00016     number_of_chequebooks = models.IntegerField(max_length=50)
00017     def __unicode__(self):
00018         return self.account_number
00019 
00020 ##This is used to create Cheque table in the database to store cheque information
00021 class Cheque(models.Model):
00022         ##cheque number present on the cheque type: int
00023     cheque_number = models.IntegerField(max_length=6)
00024         ##cheque issue date type: date
00025     date = models.DateField()
00026         ##Cheque amount type: decimal
00027     amount = models.DecimalField(max_digits=50, decimal_places=2)
00028         ##Payee name ype: char
00029     payee_name = models.CharField(max_length=50)
00030         ##micr number present on cheque, type: int
00031     micr_number = models.IntegerField(max_length=9)
00032         ##Account number- foreign key of Account model
00033     account_number = models.ForeignKey(Account)
00034         ##Cheque Status type: chat
00035     status = models.CharField(max_length=30)
00036     def __unicode__(self):
00037         return self.cheque_number
00038 
00039 ##This is used to create Cheque Book table in the database to store cheque book information
00040 class ChequeBook(models.Model):
00041         ##Account number- foreign key of Account model
00042     account_number = models.ForeignKey(Account)
00043         ##Size of the cheque book type: int
00044     size = models.IntegerField(max_length=11)
00045         ##Issue date of cheque, type: date
00046     issue_date = models.DateField('issue date')
00047         ##Starting cheque number type: int
00048     first_cheque_number = models.IntegerField(max_length=6)
00049     def __unicode__(self):
00050         return self.account_number_id
00051 
00052 ##This is used to create Employee table in the database to store employee information
00053 class Employee(models.Model):
00054         ##Employee id for authentication type: char
00055     employee_id = models.CharField(max_length=50)
00056         ##Employee name type: char
00057     name = models.CharField(max_length=50)
00058         ##Password for authentication type: char
00059     password = models.CharField(max_length=50)
00060     def __unicode__(self):
00061         return self.employee_id
00062 
00063 ##This is used to create Customer table in the database to store customer information
00064 class Customer(models.Model):
00065         ##Customer name type: char
00066     name = models.CharField(max_length=50)
00067         ##Username of customer for authentication type: char
00068     username = models.CharField(max_length=50)
00069         ## Password for authentication type: char
00070     password = models.CharField(max_length=50)
00071         ##Account number of the customer type: char
00072     account_number = models.ForeignKey(Account)
00073     def __unicode__(self):
00074         return self.username
00075 
00076 class Transaction(models.Model):
00077     transaction_id = models.IntegerField(max_length=50)
00078     date = models.DateField()
00079     time = models.TimeField()
00080     from_account_number = models.ForeignKey(Account)
00081     to_account_number = models.CharField(max_length=10)
00082     amount = models.DecimalField(max_digits=50, decimal_places=2)
00083     employee_id = models.ForeignKey(Employee)
00084     def __unicode__(self):
00085         return self.transaction_id
